Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ale s
Reviews.Content: It isn't in city center but it is well-located (1 minute and half by walk from Blissenstrasse underground station, then 40 minutes to AlexanderPlatz). The double room (with a sink in the corner, a desk, a tv and 3 chairs) was big, clean and tidy; it overlooked the backyard. We could hear noises from other rooms and the floor was creaking. Nevertheless, the night was quiet and peaceful (actually we were completely tired and devasted when we came back home!). The shared bathroom (one toilet and one shower) was ok: not stylish but always clean and available. In the morning we went downstairs for the breakfast. A typical continental breakfast (milk (only cold!), coffee, juice, bread, butter, jam, ham, cheese, tomatoes and so on....). We ate a lot! The staff was friendly (they didn't ask us anything for the parking ticket (in fact we needed it just for few hours....)). Price: 60€ P.S. The East Berlin (Friedrichshain) was really interesting!

Reviews.Title: “Gasteiner Hof is a great and fare choice in Berlin city”
Reviews.Author: KaoChingLin
Reviews.Content: Back to Gasteiner Hof Feb.2011, breakfast is still great with sufficient coffee, milk, juice, hams, cheese, bread and you can get as many as you want ^ ^. the area for breakfast is just re-furnished with new dinning table and coaches. Gasteiner Hof provides the wireless internet connection and that can be connected in my own room. that's great and easy to use my internet phone to make an internatinal call with low fares. amazingly comparing the experience of staying Gasteiner Hof 4 years ago, I found the surrounding area is more convenient to find more restaurants and supermarkets ( one of them is openning to 9:00pm ). that makes me easier to get food or other supplies. I was told by staff in Gasteiner Hof that there's a self service laundry store just 2 stations of Berlin U-Bahn away. that's good way to get my clothes clean. Staff is nice and willing to help. Gasteiner Hof is a great and fare choice in Berlin city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and easy to find”
Reviews.Author: KaoChingLin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Gasteiner Hof for three nights 4 years ago~ and will be back there this month since the good quality and nice service. that's easy to find the supermarkets and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value pension on city centre fringe”
Reviews.Author: jimmcateer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gasteiner Hof for four nights in September 2010. It was the first city on a train journey through central Europe, when we also visited Prague, Vienna and Budapest. The hotel has directions on its website. We landed at Schoenfeld airport, to the southeast of Berlin. From there we took a 171 bus to Rudow U-bahn station (10 minutes) where underground Line 7 goes without change to Blissestrasse (30 minutes). The hotel lies in a side road 100 metres to the north of the station and, after one false start, we found it without undue difficulty. Our room (two floors above ground) was spacious, bright and clean. The shower / wc was cramped but adequate, with plenty of towels and hot water. The glazing was sufficient to eliminate street noise, though there was some audible sounds from other rooms. Though the mattresses were a little thin, the beds were comfortable and we slept well. The room was well maintained and supplied during our stay. There is no elevator and no nighttime reception. I was able to settle my bill with a debit card. The buffet breakfasts were on the generous side of adequate, with cereal, cold meats, cheese, eggs, bread, yogurt and fruit, with unlimited tea, coffee and toast. Getting to and from the buffet table can be awkward in the smallish breakfast room. The area is not oversupplied with quality restaurants, although we had a fair value meal at the nearby Badenscher Hof jazz club on a Friday night (it’s beer rather than wine here, as the latter is wildly overpriced). Otherwise, you can risk a local Imbiss (Berlin fast food takeaway / restaurant) or go uptown. There is a very handy and good 24 hour supermarket nearby on Berliner Strasse. Getting around means using Berlin public transport: tube, bus and tram. The system is fairly intuitive, and a day ticket for the AB zone was a reasonable €6.10. Though German transport has a fine reputation, our final days were bedevilled with ticket machine issues, and service failures due to engineering works, demonstrations and mechanical breakdown; so allow sufficient time for your journey.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Troubadour
Reviews.Content: Clean, simple rooms. Paid 72 euros for a double (room 23 w/WC+shower). Breakfast OK. Conveniently located, close to metro, Internet café, restaurants, supermarket, Badenscher Hof jazz club, etc. Only genuine nuisance was to be asked for cash payment - "there are lots of banks around here". Took some time to find one, and German ATMs don't always recognize non-German credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trotterBremen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a small living street close to the city center West (Kurfuerstendamm). It has only few rooms (approx. 20), it provides a really nice familiar ambience. The rooms are big, bright and well equipped. The hotel is very clean, the continental breakfast is good and the staff is very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: mr.fixit2go
Reviews.Content: We booked a quad-room via email. The Hotel is nestled in a older building in a residential area. The streets were narrow but managable and there were always a few parking places nearby. Half a block to the subway and a wonderful array of restaurants close by. Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly woman who was helpful and informative. The room was clean with ample room for the four of us. The bedding was changed daily! A small modern shower was retrofitted in a small room off to the side in the room. The breakfasts were the usual continental style with a nice selection of meats, cheeses, yogurt, rolls, etc. The desk is staffed from 8am to 10pm and are always eager to assist. It isn't a shiny new hotel, but it is clean and comfortable and very affordable. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: SDCS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Sept 2006. Noticed on the first two nights that the walls were a bit thin between the rooms as we could hear the neighbours' TV in the middle of the night but it wasn't a big problem. On the third night, a large group of university students checked in and took up our entire floor. We got back to the hotel a bit after 10pm (which is when the reception desk closes) and when we entered our room we were gobsmacked by the noise from the next room. It seemed that all of the students were partying in the room next to ours. As the hours went by and no doubt more and more alcohol was consumed, the noise became worse. It sounded like they were jumping off furniture and tackling each other, banging into our wall, yelling and screaming like they were in a frenzy. They eventually went out at around 3am and came back at around 5am. When we checked out the following morning we complained about the noise and said we didn't think we should have to pay for that night (or at least not the full amount). The person on the desk disagreed and said we will have to pay the full amount as it is their policy and they're not responsible for the behaviour of their guests. So we received no compensation for our night of hell in this hotel. Aside from this incident the hotel itself is OK, location is fine, food is OK but their lack of concern regarding our complaint was disgusting. If you value your sleep or if you want half decent customer service DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean & spacious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a very pleasant week at the Gasteiner Hof. Room was clean & spacious. Shower & breakfast both first rate. Great location, close to all attractions and only a stone's throw from the nearest underground station. Staff really helpful & friendly. Highly recommended, a great spot at a really reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “nice, small hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was last week in Berlin and i stayed the 3th time in Hotel Gastiner Hof. It is an excellent hotel near the U-Bahn Blisse-Strasse (Berlin-Wilmersdorf) The romms are comfortable and the staff was always very friendly and helpful. Unbeatable location, directly to the U-Bahn-station and near the Kudamm. The breakfast was very rich with with various meals like cheeses, cold meat, cereals, egss. I think it is ideal for people who dont want to spend a lot of money and want a good stay there in the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: SlaviaPraha
Reviews.Content: We paid 49 euro per night which was great value for money. The owner was very friendly and helpful, as were reception staff. Huge breakfast, with large choice. In December the weather was very cold, but this hotel did not skimp on heating and the room was very warm throughout our stay. The hotel sells a range of transport and attraction tickets. U Bahn only two minutes away. The hotel has a bar, at reasonable prices.

HotelInfo.Name: Gasteiner Hof
HotelInfo.Address: Gasteinerstrasse 8, 10717 Berlin, Germany
